page.title: 01Introduction to the area
page.content: This area is in Greater London.Its western boundary is on high ground sloping down to the river Wandle which runs from south to north through the centre. It includes parts of Wimbledon, Tooting and Wandsworth. These were once seperate villages but they were joined in the last century when the railway made it possible for London workers to live in the country. Even today many inhabitants of the area travel by the Southern Region of British Rail or the District Line of the underground to jobs in Central London.There is still much C19 housing - big houses with large gardens in the west and small terraced houses in the east - mixed in with industry and commerce. There are also several open spaces.
